subprocess_flow.description: The initial sub-step involves the procurement of all necessary raw materials, including active pharmaceutical ingredients (APIs), excipients, and packaging components. This includes vendor selection, quality assessment of materials, and ensuring compliance with regulatory standards. Robust supply chain management is critical to mitigate risks associated with material availability and quality.
success_criteria: Availability of all required raw materials
subprocess_flow.purpose: To ensure the availability of high-quality raw materials for drug product manufacturing.
subprocess_flow.scope: Sourcing, qualification, and procurement of raw materials.

step_risks_and_controls.control: Multiple qualified vendors, safety stock levels.
Vendor audits, material testing, and certificates of analysis.

change_management.change_request_process: Changes to raw material vendors or specifications require a formal change control process, including impact assessment and approval by quality assurance.
change_management.versioning_rules: Raw material specifications and vendor documentation are version-controlled.

subprocess_flow.description: This sub-step involves the actual manufacturing of the drug substance (API) according to validated manufacturing processes. This includes weighing, mixing, reaction, purification, and drying of the drug substance. In-process controls and monitoring are implemented to ensure product quality and consistency. Equipment validation and calibration are also critical components.
success_criteria: Manufacturing process adheres to validated parameters
subprocess_flow.purpose: To produce the drug substance (API) at the required quality and yield.
subprocess_flow.scope: Manufacturing of the drug substance from raw materials.
end_conditions: Drug substance released by quality control

step_risks_and_controls.control: Validated manufacturing process, trained personnel, and deviation management system.
Preventive maintenance, equipment validation, and backup equipment.

change_management.change_request_process: Changes to the manufacturing process or equipment require a formal change control process, including impact assessment and approval by quality assurance.
change_management.versioning_rules: Manufacturing process documents and equipment validation reports are version-controlled.

subprocess_flow.description: The drug product manufacturing sub-step involves formulating the drug substance into the final drug product dosage form (e.g., tablets, capsules, injections). This includes blending, granulation, tableting, encapsulation, filling, and packaging. Stringent quality control measures are implemented throughout the process to ensure product quality, safety, and efficacy. Environmental monitoring and cleaning validation are also essential.
success_criteria: Manufacturing process adheres to validated parameters
subprocess_flow.purpose: To formulate the drug substance into the final drug product dosage form.
subprocess_flow.scope: Formulation, filling, and packaging of the drug product.
end_conditions: Drug product released by quality control

step_risks_and_controls.control: Dedicated equipment, cleaning validation, and environmental monitoring.
In-process controls, equipment calibration, and trained personnel.

change_management.change_request_process: Changes to the manufacturing process, equipment, or packaging require a formal change control process, including impact assessment and approval by quality assurance.
change_management.versioning_rules: Manufacturing process documents, equipment validation reports, and packaging specifications are version-controlled.

subprocess_flow.description: This sub-step involves rigorous quality control testing of both the drug substance and drug product to ensure compliance with established specifications. This includes analytical testing, microbiological testing, and stability testing. Testing is performed according to validated analytical methods, and results are reviewed and approved by quality control personnel. Reference standards and controls are used to ensure accuracy and reliability.
success_criteria: Drug substance and drug product meet quality specifications
Analytical methods are validated and accurate
subprocess_flow.purpose: To ensure the drug substance and drug product meet established quality specifications.
subprocess_flow.scope: Analytical and microbiological testing of drug substance and drug product.
end_conditions: Drug substance and drug product released by quality control

step_risks_and_controls.control: Validated analytical methods, trained personnel, and reference standards.
Investigation of OOS results, corrective actions, and retesting.

change_management.change_request_process: Changes to analytical methods or testing procedures require a formal change control process, including validation and approval by quality assurance.
change_management.versioning_rules: Analytical methods and testing procedures are version-controlled.

subprocess_flow.description: This sub-step involves the packaging and labeling of the drug product according to regulatory requirements and marketing specifications. This includes primary packaging (e.g., blister packs, vials), secondary packaging (e.g., cartons), and labeling. Labeling accuracy and packaging integrity are critical to ensure product identification, safety, and compliance. Serialization and track-and-trace systems may be implemented to prevent counterfeiting.
subprocess_flow.purpose: To package and label the drug product for distribution and sale.
subprocess_flow.scope: Packaging, labeling, and serialization of the drug product.
triggers: Release of drug product by quality control
end_conditions: Packaged and labeled drug product ready for shipment

step_risks_and_controls.control: Automated labeling systems, barcode scanning, and label reconciliation.
Automated inspection systems, packaging material testing, and trained personnel.

change_management.change_request_process: Changes to packaging materials, labels, or packaging processes require a formal change control process, including impact assessment and approval by quality assurance.
change_management.versioning_rules: Packaging specifications and label artwork are version-controlled.

subprocess_flow.description: The final sub-step involves the release of the finished drug product by quality assurance and its subsequent distribution to commercial markets. This includes final product inspection, documentation review, and approval for shipment. Distribution is managed according to established procedures to maintain product integrity and prevent diversion. Temperature monitoring and cold chain management are critical for temperature-sensitive products.
success_criteria: Drug product meets all release criteria
Distribution is managed according to established procedures
Product integrity is maintained during shipment
subprocess_flow.purpose: To release the finished drug product for distribution and sale.
subprocess_flow.scope: Final product inspection, release, and distribution to commercial markets.
subprocess_flow.process_owner: Quality Assurance Manager and Logistics Manager
end_conditions: Drug product shipped to distribution centers

step_risks_and_controls.control: Secure distribution channels, track-and-trace systems, and inventory controls.
Temperature-controlled transportation, temperature monitoring devices, and cold chain management procedures.

change_management.change_request_process: Changes to distribution procedures or transportation methods require a formal change control process, including impact assessment and approval by quality assurance.
change_management.versioning_rules: Distribution procedures and transportation validation reports are version-controlled.
